content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the implementation of the `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(input_string::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(input_string)
    output_string = ""
    current_line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        if current_line_length + length(word) + 1 <= text_width
            output_string *= word * " "
            current_line_length += length(word) + 1
        else
            output_string *= "\n" * word * " "
            current_line_length = length(word) + 1
        end
    end
    
    return output_string
end
```

Example of using the `wrap_string` function:

```julia
input_text = "Hello world, this is an example of wrapping text in Julia"
wrapped_text = wrap_string(input_text, 15)
println(wrapped_text)
```

This will output:

```
Hello world, 
this is an 
example of 
wrapping text 
in Julia
```
